name: Nektulos Forest
description: Nektulos Forest is the ancestral home of the Teir'Dal and the location of Nektropos Castle.

npcs.name: Aleeshi Monala
utterances: You're not a friend of the Hand. Please leave my presence.

npcs.name: an arbiter of the trials
utterances: So, you're the new fodder, eh? I've been doing this for centuries. I remember when Master Szin faced these same Trials. I have a word of advice for you, if you care to hear it.
Szin isn't a fair or honorable man in the least. His theory has always been strength in numbers, if you get what I'm saying. I best keep my mouth shut, though. Good luck to you.

npcs.name: Arqis
utterances: I can tell you're out of your natural element. Nektulos is no place for a Norrathian to play. Whatever you seek is not here, but you will seek that which is here...
Your lot is always filled with questions and no answers. I am Arqis and I wander many places. This day I am here. This day I will help you make sense of your journey into this place.
What I have to say is simple: Leave this place. Go back to the safe haven of your city. Seek a place filled with knowledge. You will find purpose there.
Go home. Seek a place where knowledge is stacked in leather bound books. There you will find Cauldron Hollow. That is all I have to say ... for now.
Your curiosity has blossomed. You should seek Cauldron Hollow. But where to start?
And how will you get these keys? Will you call forth the ghosts of the ancient lords of Nektulos? How can you accomplish such a feat?
You are wiser than I thought. Yet, you cannot light the torches; to do so you must acquire the Spark of the Beacons. This imbued power will light the torches. But who holds this power?
Very good, but like the lords, they too are long dead. Their bodies were consecrated at the Dragoon's Funeral Pyre in this forest. You can seize their power if you can resurrect these knights.

Seek the dragonfly fairy Dalninia. She has your answers. Find  her on the isle within the Torrent River. When you have earned the Spark of the Beacons,  I shall offer you the final piece of your puzzle.
I do not know, but it is a necessary point in your line of fate. It is but one step on a long ascent.
Someday we will meet again. And you shall repay me. We are done for now.
To complete your journey, you must call the ghosts of the three warlords that are beckoned by the lighting of the Torches of Forewarning ... but this is only part of the puzzle...
The power must be concentrated. It must be conducted through a wand of natural forces.
You cannot find this wand in any school of magic; it's a branch of great arcane power.

In the great forest plateau is a good treant who holds the answer to your question. His name is Rulinthus, and he is the last of his kind here in this forest. He can dispel the druidic curse that keeps the ghosts at bay. As for us; we are done.

npcs.name: Arthial the Protector
utterances: I must attend to other matters at the moment.

npcs.name: Bain Rockfist
utterances: Ahh, I see you made it all right... Best be careful running 'round these parts.

npcs.name: Bernd Frostbeard
utterances: Speak to one of the other members of the Hand.
I'm afraid there's nothing you can do to help us here. Perhaps later when you're more experienced, we'll have something for you.

npcs.name: Bruhn K'Viir
utterances: You are quite a pitiful specimen. In fact, I am quite appalled that you are able to speak. You are able to speak, correct?

Did you really think that I would answer that? I don't know you from any other fool who wanders along, saying hello for no good reason. They run by saying hello like I have pretty presents to hand out. It disgusts me.

Hmm, maybe you are, maybe you aren't. It doesn't really matter in the long run, does it? If you are truly interested in why we are here, then I have a task you could perform to prove yourself, if you wish it.
Funny... Do you want to learn or not, fool?

Good. I need you to travel to each of our field scouts and deliver them supplies. They should be rather easily found. There are three camps: Two are here on the beach, and the other is just past the hidden beach path. Now, go. Please refrain from wasting both our time by puttering around aimlessly.
Have you completed your tasks yet?
And you're still alive... I'm impressed. Take this and speak with me again when you're ready for your next task.
Congratulations. You are not as incompetent as I thought. Were the scouts nice to you?
They have standing orders to attack anyone they do not recognize, so yes and no... Do you still wish to learn more about our order?

If you travel around the beach you will find several groups of filthy humans. One of these camps holds the tents of both the Tactician and the Commander. We have heard rumors that the pirates are planning to expand off the beach and deeper into the forest. We do not wish this, of course. I need you to find the Tactician's tent and steal the attack plans. Can you handle that?
Good. Be quick about it.
Good work. I will give these to Szin. Take this for your time and return to me later. I have more tasks for you.

Those plans were quite useful. More so than you, in fact. Nonetheless, I cannot ignore the aid you have provided, no matter how much I dislike that you have potential. I will give you another chance to earn our trust, if you think you can handle a real task...

I need you to find the Tactician and Commander and scour them from this beach. The plans for taking over the forest were more involved than we thought possible of their little human brains. Can you handle that?
Go quickly, before they begin to move.

You have performed well. You show an interest in knowing why we are here. The book I gave you will answer many of your questions. You should feel honored; few have even touched that book in centuries.

Yes, this of course isn't going to be, "Oh, let's go sit under a tree and read this book!" You should know better. These pages are shielded with an arcane magic beyond the comprehension of most mortal beings. It requires blood to reveal the truth written in its pages. You will know what kind of blood it desires when the time comes.

All you have to do is take a look at the book and it will take you from there. If you manage to read the entire thing, come back and speak with Torq. He has more tasks for you if you wish to continue with the Trials.
I am finished with you. Make sure you have read the entire book and then speak with Torq.

npcs.name: Burvich
utterances: I'm making a killing here!
What the Overlord doesn't know won't hurt him!

npcs.name: a cackling cadaver
utterances: Your blood calls to me.
Your eyes are so pretty.
Seek death and it finds you.
Final death comes at last.
You've shaken the dust from my bones.
Rest in peace.

npcs.name: Captain Corrigan
utterances: Ah, ready to sail, eh? I'm waiting on my other passengers, the Seamist fairies yonder.  Go talk to Seamist Fairy Nerina, see if you can hurry her along.

npcs.name: Captain D'Lex
utterances: Rest in peace.

npcs.name: Captain T'Sanne
utterances: As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
That pile of bones was my friend!

npcs.name: Cryptomancer Nasrara
utterances: The Brethren can use individuals like you. Are you interested in assisting us in our endeavors?
Do you wish to pursue an individual assignment or an assignment that is suited for a team of adventurers?
We need you to investigate the recently unearthed caverns. Find the entrance that I indicate and proceed within.

npcs.name: Daisy Winterhope
utterances: Are you looking for something worthwhile to do?  Or are you just passing by and being polite?
You see my vessel off shore there, the "Maid for the Mist"?  I'm making her ship-shape for another perilous journey.  This time, to the Sea of Mist.  Ever heard tell of the Sea of Mist?  Hmmm?
A long time ago, afore the world was all tore up in the Shattering, Halflings like me lived in a beautiful place called the Misty Thicket.  A real nice spot it was.  Then everything changed.

Now there ain't as many Halflings as once was, and the Thicket came to be an island: the Enchanted Lands.  All around the Enchanted Lands is the Sea of Mist.  You can kind of guess how it got its name.
Yep, fog and mist that's so thick, you could cut it with a blade.  That's not the only reason it's dangerous, though.  But I gotta know what's on the other side.  I gotta get my ship ready to go.

All I need's a few more things and my shipwright can finish the job.  Whaddya say, can you help me get a few odds and ends?  If you help me out, I'll make sure you can get there and back on any of my ships.

Great!  What I need first off are some ironshell carapaces.  You can get them off them Nerius crabs.  About twenty-five would protect the hull.  Let me know when you've got those, and then we'll see if we need anything else.
I've gotten most of my other materials; how's it coming with them ironshell carapaces?
Let me see! Let me see! Ahhhh ...  Perfect!  You done a great job!  Now, maybe you could do just one more thing for me?
This one's pretty easy.  I'm sealing up a few leaks...

Now, now, they're minor leaks.  What works real well is to tighten up some of the connections with reinforcements of bear sinew.  And the best bear sinews happen to be right here in Nektulos.  How lucky is that?
Only thirteen ash owlbear sinews from Nektulos Forest will do! Are you ready for a good hunt?
How's the hunt for the ash owlbears?
Terrific! The 'Maid for the Mist' will be ready to sail very soon! I haven't forgotten my promise! You ride for free, friend! Just talk to Captain Corrigan when you're ready to go!

npcs.name: Dalninia
utterances: A child of the city in my forest? You should not be here. It's too dangerous for you. You're lucky I speak Norrathian, or this warning would go unheeded.
The Knights of the Beacon? They are evil beings bound to this land. They would do no good in this forest. That's why I keep the secret of their resurrection. Why should I give it to you?
Arqis? Is that his name this season? He is no friend of mine, but he is no foe either. This is true of you as well. If you were an ally then I would offer you what you seek.
I'm not looking for a friend. The trees and the flowers are my friends. I seek an ally. One who serves the fairy realm.
Do not serve me. Serve the fairy realm. Seek out one of the fairy queens of this forest. If she can call you ally, then I shall also.
Yes. The forest has told me so. You have also made an enemy with the Sullian folke.
You are. And as I promised, I will give you the key to resurrecting the Knights of the Beacon but beware ... Awakening them from a deep slumber shall enrage the dead knights.

Of course they won't hand it over! To be imbued with the Spark of the Beacons you must defeat the knights in battle. Only then will the power flow through your veins. But other dangers lurk where the knights are bound...
Sentries of evil undead dragoons guard the Dragoon Funeral Pyre! Before you enter the pyre you must rid this forest of those undead guardians.
The pyre rests just beyond the bridge that spans the stream that was once the River of Blood.

npcs.name: Dannian Blackleaf
utterances: Why, hello.  You're another wanderer here in the forest.  Make sure you respect these woods, for the trees are quite nasty this time of year.  Tending to these woods isn't like it used to be!
Why, me of course!  Due to the world suffering such calamities, I've taken it upon myself to prevent a very serious problem from happening.  This is why I'm clipping the feathers on the owlbears.

Just look at them!  They're huge!  Think of the monumental consequences if they flew away from the forest and started populating the rest of the world! The world would be overrun with these ravenous beasts!

You're just like the other druids, you know that?  You're all a bunch of close-minded, ignorant fools!  This must be taken care of before it's too late!  This is also why I'm capping the teeth on the beavers and teaching all of the giant spiders to start eating more vegetables instead of live meat!  As a matter of fact, I'm about to...

npcs.name: Daria
utterances: These two are impossible! Always bickering over who wins most and who doesn't cheat.
You don't know?  It's all the rage these days, it seems. In your travels, have you ever noticed the small rainbows near the ground in certain areas?

Those rainbows seem to be linked to what we call scrying stones. If you use a stone while near a rainbow, something magical happens. I don't know exactly how it works, but sometimes you can find treasure with them.

Oh, it's great fun. Here, I think I have some extra stones on me for you to try it. Take these scrying stones and try your hand at it. I will only give you these five, though. If you run out, you will need to shop around the merchants at the docks for more. Have fun!

npcs.name: Daryus Springfyre
utterances: You look a mite haggard, adventurer. Maybe some ale could pick up your spirits?

npcs.name: Da'ud Kateb
utterances: Terribly drab place this... Wouldn't you agree?

npcs.name: a Defender of Growth
utterances: Be safe, friend.

npcs.name: a distraught survivor
utterances: I was hoping to never see another meteor impact, as long as I lived.
Was this the first salvo of some geomantic attack upon us by Qeynosians!?

npcs.name: a distressed merchant
utterances: I beg of you to help me.  These foul beasts have blocked off my escape.  Help me out and I'll help you in return.

npcs.name: Doctor Arcana
utterances: I have nothing to offer you, but hope for the future.

npcs.name: a Dragoon captain
utterances: That pile of bones was my friend!
You cannot eliminate us!
To the grave with you!
As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!

npcs.name: a Dragoon dirth
utterances: You cannot eliminate us!
That pile of bones was my friend!

npcs.name: Dragoon K'Naae
utterances: To make it this far in the Nektulos forest demonstrates a sizeable amount of bravery.  This act alone has bought you a sliver of time.  State your business quickly or I will gut you where you stand.
In this time of cataclysm I only recognize two types of people.  You are either an ally to the Thexian cause or an enemy to it.  Unfortunately for you, none here can call you an ally.

You foolishly think that we would easily grant such a thing to the likes of you?  You could very well be an assassin or a spy.  I should quickly cut you down now to prevent any disaster you look to unleash.
You presume we would accept your help.  You presume too much.  What do you think you could do to help my people?

npcs.name: a Dragoon sentry
utterances: You cannot eliminate us!
That pile of bones was my friend!
Dying didn't feel good the first time.

npcs.name: a Dragoon sylth
utterances: You cannot eliminate us!
That pile of bones was my friend!
To the grave with you!

npcs.name: Drahk Bonebroth
utterances: Too many mouths need feed, and too few chefs around da' cooking fire.
Yes, yes! Drahk cooking as much surf and turf stew and fermenting jugs of Oggok kvass for all Port Naythex. Gonna need lots of good food and drink to recover and heal!
Yes, do help! Check the provisioners' barrel nearby, see if we need more kvass or stew. Oh, and don't fret about the type of meat or kvass we deliver. Someone's gonna be glad for it!

npcs.name: Dyrina Springfyre
utterances: These far seas brutes barely let me scrape a living anymore...

npcs.name: Ensign Larkin
utterances: I think you'll like the Maid for the Mist.

npcs.name: Field Investigator Chel Morgan
utterances: I don't know how I'm going to finish these investigations.
You're here about the investigations, aren't you?  Let me tell you, it's not easy handling several investigations at once.  I can't follow up every lead.  You got that?

Sorry I snapped at you; I thought you were here  to check on my progress.  I'm investigating several different matters and I can't seem to keep up with the work.  I'm close to solving them, but I can't seem to make headway on my own.
Maybe I do.  Are you interested in helping me?  I could really use someone to do the legwork, and I'm willing to pay for your time.  What do you say?

We normally don't take cases from those Qeynosians, but a young woman named Amy Bhorgese hired me to find her sister.  Miss Bhorgese is paying good money to locate Kitty Valencia.  I've heard that Miss Valencia is here in Nektulos Forest.
How are things going, partner?

That's good news.  I'll be sure to pass the word to Miss Bhorgese.  Hmm.  Maybe you could pass the word to Miss Bhorgese for me?  She's in the Thundering Steppes.  You should be able to find her easily enough; she's awaiting word from me in one of those guard towers.
Any luck?

npcs.name: Fisherman Aurvill
utterances: Fishin's been slow these days.  Dray and Djaani and me, we goes fishin' a lot.  Well, we did before.
Daisy asked me and Dray to help her, but Dray was mean.  He didn't used to be always mean.  I wonder how come he told her no?

npcs.name: Fisherman Djaani
utterances: Fishin' used to be good around here, even with them weird things we sometimes catch.  Me, Draylix, and Aurvill been fishin' here most of our lives.
If Dray hadn't got so mad at that halfling, we could've helped her.  Glad someone did.

npcs.name: Fisherman Draylix
utterances: Leave me alone! You are going to scare off all the fish.

npcs.name: Gogas Afadin
utterances: I am very busy and you are hindering my work. Please leave.

npcs.name: Grandma Blumble
utterances: I can never get my wailing just right. Is it Oooeeeooo or Eeeoooeee? They'll never take me seriously if I don't get it right...

npcs.name: a gratified merchant
utterances: That was very brave of you!  I need to leave soon, but I can offer my services in the meantime.

npcs.name: a griffin tamer
utterances: Greetings traveler, how can I assist you today?
It's been a real treat watching this tower be built by all the artisans. They've done a marvelous job getting it ready for our flying friends.
These towers were built very fast, and we were unable to get the griffin stock up to what it should be. This has made scheduling flights very difficult.

Oh, certainly. But they've got to be trained properly from birth, really. I'll tell you what, if you grab an unhatched griffin egg and return it to any of us tamers, you will be rewarded handsomely. How's that sound?
Oh, my, that's a gorgeous egg! Let me just put it down right over here. Our thanks, it's going to be rough for the handlers to raise all these!

npcs.name: a guardian mist grinnin
utterances: Help! Help! Big ones coming!

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex captain
utterances: Final death comes at last.

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex cleric
utterances: That pile of bones was my friend!
To the grave with you!
I didn't need those bones anyway.
You cannot eliminate us!

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex high guard
utterances: Dying didn't feel good the first time.
You cannot eliminate us!
I didn't need those bones anyway.

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex lieutenant
utterances: Final death comes at last.
Rest in peace.

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex mystic
utterances: Final death comes at last.
Your blood calls to me.

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex ravager
utterances: Brains! It's what's for dinner.
You cannot eliminate us!
As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
That pile of bones was my friend!

npcs.name: a Gul'Thex revenant
utterances: I didn't need those bones anyway.
Final death comes at last.
Rest in peace.
As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
You cannot eliminate us!
To the grave with you!

npcs.name: Harbormaster T'Krit
utterances: The Journey's End is currently in Butcherblock Mountains.
The Journey's End will be arriving from Butcherblock Mountains shortly.
The Journey's End will be leaving for Butcherblock Mountains in 64 seconds.
The Journey's End will be leaving for Butcherblock Mountains in 59 seconds.
The Journey's End has left for Butcherblock Mountains, it will be returning soon.

npcs.name: Harold Winemaster
utterances: I already told you, I didn't have anything to do with it!

npcs.name: The Herald of Nektropos
utterances: Welcome to Nektropos Castle. The master is expecting you.
You may now enter the castle of the House of Everling. The master awaits.

npcs.name: Investigator Dahno
utterances: Well met. Either you have business with me, or you're wasting my time. If it's the latter, shove off.
You can take on an assignment for yourself or one that requires the help of your comrades. Which interests you?
We've received news of nearby barrows that were unearthed recently. Proceed to the entrance that I indicate and venture within.
Back so soon? Good. I have an assignment for you. You interested?
I don't have any assignments for you at the moment. Come back in a day or so.
I've heard reports of newly discovered caverns nearby. I want you and your comrades to proceed to an entrance that I indicate and delve below.

npcs.name: Jaeta H'arn
utterances: You must prove yourself to Bruhn and Torq, then I will decide if I wish to speak with you.

npcs.name: Jawharah Izzah
utterances: Be on your way.

npcs.name: Jonovan the Young
utterances: Thank you for your help, friend.

npcs.name: The Keeper of Secrets
utterances: When the one who walked from the water is made whole, the heralds of the nine shall arise. Knowledge is key. That is all.

npcs.name: Kenny
utterances: Ahhhh! Whh whho are you?
Whhha whhhat do you want?
I... I am not a doll... Well, at least I wasn't always a doll.
I was once a powerful shaman... I was known throughout my home lands. Alas, now I am but a play thing.
Yes, but I was a healer of body and mind. Who would take such healing from something that looks as I do? Not to mention there is the terms of my curse.
The one who cursed me is holding a ransom on my soul. I can never truly be free unless I am to pay him a rather large sum of money.
The amount of money I would need would be significant...

npcs.name: Keryx Darkblade
utterances: I have nothing for you, speak to one of the others.

npcs.name: Kitty Valencia
utterances: If you insist on talking to me, maybe you could make yourself useful...
My mother got mauled by an owlbear and the wound's infected.  I need someone who's an expert at gathering herbs to help me.
Listen, I don't have any sisters.  My name is Kitty Valencia, but that's the only true statement you've made.  So who is "my sister" and why are you after me?
My ... father?  I never met him.  Or Amy.  She'd be my half-sister, if your story's true.  How do I know you're not trying to trick me?

I'm staying right here, thank you.  I don't need an inheritance. If I were so important to my father, he'd have sent word while he was still alive.  He could've found me and my mother if he wanted to find us. Thanks for nothing.

I have a list of ingredients for a poultice.  It's pretty complex: steppes mountain berries, oolong tea leaves and fayberries from the polluted natural gardens around Nektulos Forest. Just bring me back the stuff on my list; I don't care what you do with anything extra you find.
Back already?  Or did you give up?

I'm sorry I snapped at you.  Gathering isn't my thing and I'm worried about putting this stuff together. Let's see what you have ...  Great, some tea leaves, mountain berries and fayberries.  My mom's in a lot of pain and it bothers me to see her this way.

Maybe.  I've had some bad experiences though.  I can't trust anyone.  Anyway, could you do me one more favor before you go?  I meant to check the docks to see if the Maid for the Mist was repaired.  Could you walk down to Port Naythex and check for me?
Did you make it to Port Naythex?
No ship, huh?  I was hoping to catch the Maid for the Mist or one of the other big ships to the Enchanted Lands for one last ingredient.  I suppose I can make a substitution.
Mom said this would work too, but I need more of it to match the potency.  If you bring me some Sullian fairydust from here in Nektulos Forest, I'll pay you for your hard work.  Please?
Have you scraped together enough Sullian fairy dust for me?

It helps me, not her.  I'm tired of listening to her whine and complain.  This poultice will finish off what that owlbear's mauling started.  Her suffering is nothing compared to mine! Once she's gone, I'll be free to do things my own way.  Thanks a lot, friend.
Go away.

npcs.name: Kixizor Z'Nast
utterances: I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: Kleron Asana
utterances: It's not often you see someone wandering through the back hills of this dark, dark forest.  Stories tell of missing travelers disappearing all the time.  I know how it happens, too.

Well, what happens is this ... first, there's a rustling in the bushes, you see?  Then the traveler turns around to look what made that sound.  That's when I jump down from the trees and cut their throat open from behind. Guess what's about to happen to you?

Heh. I like that. I like that one a lot. You've got some brass, you know that? I like a person with brass. Not like the last guy I slit open. He had lots of other things but no brass.  HA!  I made a funny, too!

Nothing.  I'm letting you go.  Already told you I liked you.  Hey... there is something, though.  I've got all this loot from my last victim, but I don't need any of it.  I'd be willing to broker a trade for the items, if you're interested.

This guy had some wristguards, a helmet, a shiny earring ... um ... what else do I have here.  These leggings won't do me any good.  Yeah, and a nice pair of shoes, too.  You can't go wrong with a good pair of shoes.  And also ... um ... nope, that was all he had.  So what do you want?

The earring?  It looks pretty, I guess.  I've got enough jewelry already; I don't really need any more.  How about this trade?  I get a bit thirsty out here from time to time, attacking people and all.  If you can gather some of the ingredients I use to brew special ale I like, I'll give you this earring.  Here's the list of what I need.
Yeah, this is exactly what I wanted.  I only need a pinch or two of each, you can keep the rest.  Here, the item is yours now.  Nice doing business with ya.
Yes?  What did you need, hmm?
I think so, let me look.  Yes, I have more.  What interests you?

The wristguards are in great shape.  If you want them, then I'm going to need you to gather up some ingredients I need for a special poison.  Here's a list of what I need you to get.  If you bring these back to me, I'll give you the wristguards.

This here is a nice helm.  I'm not too sure I want to give it up after all.  Hmm ... then again, I could use someone to scout around for me.  Yeah ... listen ... if you scout around and see if any of those pirates are trying to move in on my territory, I'll give you this helm.  And bring me one of those head frills from a grinnin while you're at it.

npcs.name: Koylinite
utterances: No one enters Nektropos!
Your feeble attacks are useless!
No!  I am indestructi...

npcs.name: Kryssa Valixx
utterances: Bother me no more.  Leave me to my necrotic sstudiez before I sic ssomething to practice on you!
There is little hope of that.  I sseek a heart of pure abhorrence.  Iz your heart engorged with hate?
Fsssk!  I sseek a heart of pure abhorrence.  You do not have the experience necesssary to have engorged your heart with hate!

npcs.name: K'shar Haelbreng
utterances: I recommend you walk away before something unfortunate happens to you.

npcs.name: Laren Jadefire
utterances: You do not serve our purpose. Begone, vermin!

npcs.name: a leatherfoot tracker
utterances: My compatriot is free at last.
Might there be a release from this ... existence?

npcs.name: a leatherfoot trickster
utterances: My compatriot is free at last.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Kaneth
utterances: What do you want? If you need an escort through the forest, I don't have enough men to spare any to hold your hand for you. You're on your own here.

Work? Are you right in the head, friend? You'd have to have a death wish to want to stay here any longer than absolutely necessary. Sure I have work for you... Let's just say the Overlord has decreed that the roads must remain open at all costs and sent our legion in to pacify the forest, but we've become a little understaffed.

Well, recently the creatures here in Nektulos Forest have started behaving strangely. New species have been seen along the roads, some of them pretty nasty. I've had more than a few troops disappear out on patrol. Bah! Even the plants have changed. One of my men took a wrong step and trod on a flower. The fool was sick for days before the spiders got him, which may have been a mercy depending on how you look at it.

Well you can start by helping us keep the roads clear. We need to reduce the numbers of some of the more hazardous wildlife here near the camp. At night, though it's hard to tell if it's day or night in this blasted place, the spiders always get into the camp and they've carried off a few soldiers. You can start by getting rid of a few of them.
Did you take care of those spiders yet?
You're back and you’re still alive? Not bad. That’s better than I'd expected. Thank you for dealing with those spiders. If you're willing to do more jobs just let me know.
Are you ready for another assignment? We could certainly use the assistance.

We need to get rid of some of these wolves. We think they've been responsible for the disappearances of at least three traders in the last week. I want you to kill some of the wolves in the area and then bring back their pelts as proof.
Ahh, you're back already? Did you catch enough wolves?
Good work! Your help is certainly appreciated. Let me know if you're looking for more work. We can always use the assistance.
If you're still willing to work, I have another assignment for you.

Recently we've been seeing a new tribe of strange little fungus creatures in various parts of the forest. They've repeatedly gotten into our encampments and stolen our much needed supplies. We think they're coming from the island in the river to the northwest of here. I need someone to investigate the area and eliminate any of the little monsters you encounter. If you find anything of interest while you're out there, let me know.
So they were coming from the island? Good work. Hopefully that will keep them from troubling us for a while. Did you find anything interesting there?

Hmm. You say they were worshiping this thing? I'm not sure what it could be, but it should probably be sent back to Freeport for study. Thank you for your help. I’ll be sure to put in a good word about your work for us in my next report.

Oh, it’s you again. If you're interested in more work I could certainly use your services. It looks like another patrol has gone missing. They left the N'Mar's Ascent encampment yesterday and should have reached our camp last night, but we never heard from them. I can't afford to lose more soldiers. I need you to search for them and find out if any are still alive. If you’re up to it.
Thank you for the help. Good luck out there.
You’re back. Did you find any sign of the patrol?
I... Well, that is unfortunate. I'll need to inform those left at N'Mar's Ascent of what's happened. Thank you for your help.
I have another assignment for you. If you are so willing.

I need someone to let Sergeant Cornelius at the N'Mar's Ascent encampment know what happened to that patrol, but I can't afford to lose any more of my men before I can request more reinforcements from Freeport. You seem to be able to handle yourself well out there. Would you be willing to make the run?
Excellent. Take this note and deliver it to Sergeant Cornelius. Be careful out there.

npcs.name: a lost dragoon
utterances: Rest in peace.
Final death comes at last.
Your eyes are so pretty.
Your blood calls to me.
Seek death and it finds you.
You've shaken the dust from my bones.

npcs.name: a lost sentry
utterances: N... no! Go away! Leave me alone!
What? No! Nooo not the bugs! The bugs! Did you see the bugs? Of course you saw the bugs. How could you not have seen the bugs? Are you dead? I am.

Don't lie to me! You saw them! They were your bugs! Why didn't I stay on the road? It.. it knocked me over. The screams! Why won't they stop? He's dead. Why won't he stop screaming? You and I were on the road. Just the road... but then it dragged you away. I saw you go into the bushes, but I never saw...it. I didn't want to see it.

Why do you keep talking to me? You died! I found you... after it left. After it was done. I tried to bring you back, but you were so heavy! I dragged you until I couldn't see anymore. So dark. I hid in a tree. I'm sorry that I hid in a tree. Why do you hate me?

We're all dead! It tells me I'm dead, so I must be. It whispers. I'm sorry I hid in a tree.  I had to rest. I tried to take you the rest of the way when I was done. Why did you bring the bugs? You spoke with bugs. Words for bugs. Bugs for words. The bugs hurt me, but I ran. I should have stayed because I'm dead, but I ran. They wouldn't go in the river. No, they wouldn't.

Can't go back! Back from the dead. Already dead. You made sure. It made sure. Why is it so hot? The forest is always cold. It tells me I'm dead. It hurts me. It won't stop whispering. Why won't it stop? Why does it hate me? Why does it hurt me? Hurts so much! It hurts!

npcs.name: Loyalist Erityire
utterances: Oh, can't you see I'm busy with something?

Those accursed Asilians are at it again.  The spell that they have found is too powerful.  The creature that they could summon would surely be able to attack without any warning from our scouts.  I need to find some way to stop this from happening without breaking the "treaty".  Hum...  You look to be an able body.  Would you mind doing her majesty a favor?

Well, our treaty says that we can't start or influence any attack upon them.  So if you were to, say, go south to their lands and prevail upon their Diviners our need for them to stop the summoning, it would be appreciated.  The Queen has authorized me to reward any who is capable of stopping the Asilians without causing an all out war.
Such might from one of your kind is truly amazing.  Here is your reward for dissuading the Asilians from casting that horrible spell.

npcs.name: Mariner Guard Balstrom
utterances: You just buy the merchandise and move along.  I got my eye on you!

npcs.name: Mathra
utterances: Yes? I don’t have time for interruptions- oh, you’re the adventurer that has been helping at the outposts, aren’t you?

I’ve been sent in from Freeport to investigate the recent changes in Nektulos Forest. You see, that strange idol that you found the native Murkblooms worshipping was sent to the Dismal Rage for study. When we began examining it, we immediately realized that it has collected a sort of strange power that must have come from something within the forest, from some greater source, or perhaps even from the forest itself.

Well, we’re really not quite sure. It’s all very strange. As a druid I can in a way communicate with the wild plants and creatures of the forest, but for some reason I cannot understand most of the beasts and plant life here. It’s almost like they’re speaking a different language. The trees that I can speak to have been withdrawn and hostile, and so I haven’t been able to discover why I cannot comprehend the others.

That is where you come in. You found the idol that we have become so interested in and I’m hoping that you will be willing to assist me in uncovering more information about the changes in the forest. Well, familiarize yourself with this camp and then come see me once you’re ready for your first task.

Ready to start? Good. First things first, I need you to help me catalogue some of the new plant life that has been growing in Nektulos forest. I’ve never heard of anything like these new plants that seem to be growing everywhere here now, and I think they may be able to provide me with more clues about the causes of the changes.

Good. I need you to find the plants in the wild and catalogue them for me while I study some samples the soldiers were able to bring back. It seems the plants are not as defenseless as one may assume. I will need one of each kind catalogued... here, let me write them down for you in your journal. Once you have catalogued one of each type, return to me.
Have you finished cataloguing those plants like I asked?
Good. Yes, these will do fine. Now to compare your catalogue notes to these samples... oh, and I have more work for you, if you’re up to it. Just let me know when you’re ready.
...seems to be imbued with a strange magical energy dissimilar to any... what? Oh yes, the adventurer. I was just finishing some of my notes. Are you ready for another task?

Good. These new plants are incredibly interesting. I’ve had some time to examine these plants now and I’m certain these did not grow through any traditional means. I’ve also been studying some of the older growths in the forest and, well, it’s just astonishing!

I’ve discovered that both the strange new plants and the older growths in the forest have a collective consciousness! At first I thought I was mistaken, but the more I look it becomes obvious that this is the only way to describe the behavior of the plant life in Nektulos. I mean it’s almost like the forest is a single entity. It has a mind!

Yes! And I’m thinking maybe I can try to speak to it, but I will need your help in gathering the components to do so. I’m going to need heartwood from the blacktimber treants and some spores from the Murkblooms. Both can be found near Bone Lake.
Thank you very much. Return to me when you've finished.
Did you get the components I need to commune with the forest?
Ahhhh, good! I’ve already prepared everything in advance, so now all I have to do is add this... and a touch of spores here... good! Now to drink the mixture. Wish me luck!
And I-... Oh! Well that’s ... strange. I.. I’m not sure I can...

I... I can feel the slow thoughts of the forest. I can make sense of it now, but this almost raises more questions than answers. The forest, it is alive and it... hates. Yes, that's the way to put it. It hates... everything. This is both very worrying, and breathtaking. The forest’s mind is not new. It is old and has been dormant for a very long time, but is now awakening. But that is not what is causing me to worry.

The forest has emotions, hate being most prominent. It especially hates intruders and outsiders, which it feels we all are. But the emotion I sense that worries me is that it is almost joyous over something. It almost reminds me of a loyal hound. This is very troubling news. Thank you for your assistance, friend. I think I must now return to Freeport to report on this.
Ah, but before I forget... Lieutenant Kaneth sent over some armor pieces to reward you for your services. You may choose whichever you find most useful.

npcs.name: Millie Flunknuttle
utterances: I swear I'm just about ready to give up on this thing!
No! No! Nonononono! This thing is flonked! Oh wait, I have the remote upside down.
It's embarrassing that my father can do this so much better than I can.

npcs.name: a mist grinnin
utterances: We no can win, must flee!
They want to kill us all! Charge!
Help! Help! Big ones coming!
Attack! Attack!  Kill everything!

npcs.name: Mugwump
utterances: Why hello there.  You look to be well this day. If you are looking for some adventuring; head west across the torrent river to the beach and look for dark elf fellow by the name of Bruhn.  Too ornery for my liking, but he might have something for you to do.

npcs.name: a Nerius Commander
utterances: All hands retreat!
Cover me while we regroup!
Summon help!  We have invaders!

npcs.name: a Nerius Tactician
utterances: Who is going to swab the deck now?!
I'll send you to the Hold of Prexus!
You won't find a safe port here!

npcs.name: Noxhil V'Sek
utterances: Interesting ... you don't look like the other Thexian loyalists that wander these woods.  Why do you haunt the Nektulos?

Oh you do, do you?  Then perhaps ... perhaps I can satisfy your thirst for adventure. I left the forest for ... a long time, and need to know what changed ... in my absence.  I'll reward you well for your observations.

Go see why the behemoth that guards our pristine forest is allowing outsiders to walk freely.  Its lair is beside the river that runs through the forest ... or so the stories say.  Return when you find out why the beast isn't performing its duties.

Is that so?!  How can this be?  The bonds that held this beast were the tightest ever crafted!  I mean, if the texts are correct, that is.  This does not bode well ...  but this matter doesn't concern you.  As promised, here is your reward.  Hmmm ... Perhaps you're interested in more work?

So I see I piqued your interest ... or perhaps just your greed.  Either way, it matters not what your motivations are, just as long as you bring me your observations of areas both near and far within the Nektulos.

Well, perhaps near isn't the proper word. Direct might be the better choice. At the source of the river are the Timber Falls. I must know if ... indigenous pests still live there. Would you investigate the area for a substantial reward?

Then we agree. Follow the river north until it bends to the west.  Shortly thereafter, you should approach the falls.  Check closely for signs of the disgusting vermin that may live there.  I suspect they hide behind the falls.  Return when you determine the status of the filthy creatures.

Far in the sense that you will need to travel here and there.  I am in need of information regarding the current status of the warning torches that were erected since we ... since I've been gone.  Perhaps you would be willing to gather together the locations of these torches ... for a sizable reward, that is...

I wish to know if some specific ones have been lit. Seek the torches that travel from the south of the Combine Spires all the way east to the stone bridge. I believe you should find all eight of them upon the path, if it has not worn away over time. I need to know if a warning has been signaled ... or if the owners are still blissful in their ignorance.

Well, at least those warrior-minded fools accomplished something!  I expected those pestilent little halflings to still be in our land.  But, I digress about matters that are not your concern.  Here is the reward for your time.

I see ... perhaps the veil of ignorance is more of a deceptive mask on their part, eh?  But I speak too much... especially to one such as yourself.  And you would be far safer not to think too much upon the muddled words of a curious old man.  As I assured you, here is your reward.  Now leave me to my considerations.

Hmmm ... you've proven yourself to be most helpful--for one among the living. Perhaps it would benefit both parties if you stayed that way. Yes ... yes I have something else I need to know ... something quite important. By taking on this task, you will have intertwined yourself to us far greater than you can imagine. Is this your will?

And thus you have spoken those words on your own accord. I now task you to find out if they have ever managed to break open the gate. The great Fire Guard was erected to hold back the scaled menace that resides to the far north of Nektulos. Find out if they traffic with the nemesis. Tell me if the Fire Guard has been broken.

As I had suspected. For as much as they moan, they have not the courage to take the steps necessary. Hahaha! My Empress will be most pleased to hear those pathetic fools have degenerated themselves to nothing but domesticated dogs under her rule. As for you ... here is your reward. Your health is tied to your silence ... remember that.

npcs.name: Private Doopy
utterances: Ooohhhh ... My bones ... my poor little bones...

What ... what is that?  Is that what I think -- is that ... is that one of my bones?  Oh joyous day!  MY BONES!!!  You've found one of my bones!  If you give me my bone, I'll offer you this doohickey an adventurer dropped near my haunting place.

Oh my oh my oh my!  My bones!!!  I've never been happier in my entire life ... er ... my unlife, that is.  Here's the thingamabob I said I'd offer you!  It's a good thing I have enough of these thingamajigs for each one of my bones!

Go away or I'll scare you ... I'm a big scary ghost ... I'll haunt you forever, mwuhahaha! ... Oh, who am I kidding?  I was a poor excuse for a soldier in the Leatherfoot Brigade, and I'm even worse at being a tortured soul... oh woe is me...

I'm hiding from all the dark elf skeletons, that's what I'm doing!  They scare me to no end!  If it wasn't for the fact that my bones were blown all over this forest, I'd leave this spot.  But, but -  I haven't seen them for ages... waaaahhhh..... my bones....

npcs.name: Queen Dyleena
utterances: I see that the Asilians convinced another fool to join their cause.
Why don't you bother the Asilians for a while?
I'm slain!

npcs.name: Queen Thayilia
utterances: This is the land of the Asilians. Why do you come to our land and force me to speak your tongue?
We want nothing to do with your kind. The great races have brought us nothing but ruin. But there is a task that we Asilians cannot accomplish...
Since breaking free from the underworld forest, our enclave has been battling a neighboring group of fairies called the Sullians. We fight for dominance of what little this forest has to offer.
Slay the Sullian Queen. Without her the Sullians will be in chaos. Do this and we shall reward you.
We are in your debt. We will find a way to honor your deed. For now, all I can offer is an alliance with our enclave.

npcs.name: Rulinthus
utterances: Beware this land. What was once grand and hospitable has been tormented and twisted into something grotesque and ungracious. I am all that is left of the past.
The mounts of flame spew forth from many leagues away. A curse floats amidst the veil of ash. This curse keeps the torches dark. The spark of the beacon alone cannot light the torches.
You can't, but I can. My branches can focus the spark of the beacon for they hold a portion of the spark. Should one of my limbs come near the torches of forewarning ... they will ignite.
What kind of beast are you? To think I'd sever a limb for you! As luck would have it, I do have a small branch that a violent storm tore from my trunk.
You must strike down a treant who sways within the eastern thickets. His name is Tilberbous. Destroy him, and I shall reward you my fallen branch.
Tilberbous is but one of the branches within the evil rings of treants. His destruction is only the beginning.
Soon the war of the woodlands will begin. What is left of the true ring will battle with what is twisted.
There are few like me. Many suns shall pass before the true ring is united. But this is not your war. Ponder this no longer.
My fallen branch is yours, but its power is limited now that it is no longer part of my trunk. You must snap my branch to let loose its power. After this you must visit the first torch.

The lighting of the torches starts with the first torch. Not all are needed to call forward your ghosts. They must light as they did in the age of the past. From the gates of Neriak to the terminus of the violent flow... one by one... until the last.
Some call it the Gray Fields and others call it the Shadowrest. It has many names. Whatever the name, its a vault for lost souls.

npcs.name: Salea L'Nix
utterances: I suppose you will have to do. Beggars can't be choosers, eh?
And I must admit, I could use the assistance. I am not capable of smithing everything that's needed for the dock repairs in the time required.

Metal joint bracers and large dock bolts. It'll take a lot of both to rebuild. We aren't picky about the type of metal used, as long as you use ethereal condensate on them. It strengthens any metal! Check the smiths' crate here to see if the dock workers need more bolts or bracers.

npcs.name: Seamist Fairy Nerina
utterances: You seem ready for adventure.  Why don't you talk with Daisy Winterhope?  She's looking for someone to help her repair her ship.
You are sailing into the Sea of Mist?
My name is Nerina, and I am on a mission that involves the Sea of Mist.  It is full of many evil things.  Why do you intend to go there?
Enjoyment is not something one finds in the Sea of Mist.  My people have been charged with patrolling the Enchanted Lands to keep what dwells there, there.

Before the Shattering, the Enchanted Lands were called the Misty Thicket.  They were imbued with an essence that attracts other-worldly beings.  Now, that same essence attracts unsavory things.  Our job is to contain them.
Our enemies surged past our defenses a fortnight past.  They were stronger than they have ever been.  We hunted them down across the Sea, at great cost.  The last of them is here in Nektulos.
If you intend to sail the Sea of Mist, you should know what now inhabits the Enchanted Lands.  Would you assist me and my kinfolk in destroying the vile creatures which escaped to Nektulos?

My scouts report that one of the escaped creatures has grafted the soul of a local resident.  He or she will appear normal, yet is controlled by the creature inside.  This is dangerous, but only a taste of what is seeping into our world.  Do not be afraid.

There is the satisfaction of slaying a worthy foe.  One of the escaped creatures has grafted the soul of a local resident.  He or she will appear normal, yet is controlled by the creature inside.  You might find this ... stimulating.  Or are you afraid?

npcs.name: Sergeant Cornelius
utterances: Watch your step around here. This is not a pleasant place for a stroll.
AAAH! Oh, it’s just a traveler. Don’t you know not to sneak up on people around here?!
Well then, who are you? What are you doing here? We don't see many travelers in this part of the forest.
Oh really? Why would he send you?

Not another patrol lost! We've lost so many men! We can't afford to lose any more. This means we can't send any more patrols until we get more reinforcements. Well, that isn't your concern. Thank you for your help.
Since you've already come all this way, would you be willing to help us out with a problem? It sounds like you did some good work at the southern encampment.

We've been short on provisions lately and attempts to supplement our stores with forage from the forest have been total failures in the best of cases, and can cause casualties in the worst. We're expecting more from the Commonlands next week and had just enough to get by until then, but a few days ago something started pilfering from our food stores during the night. Last night one of the sentries managed to catch one of the culprits.

It was one of those little blue things, those grinnin that live along the river to the southwest. I need someone to attempt to recover those supplies. Just hunt them down and see if any of them still have the supplies. After our last attempt at foraging, I'd prefer not to have to try it again. Are you willing to help us out?
Good, good. While you’re at it, kill enough of them to convince them to leave our stores alone.
Oh, you're back. How did the search go? Did the grinnin still have the supplies?
Ahh, I never thought I would be so happy to see more salted beef and fish! Maybe not the moldy dried apples though. Ugh! You can keep those.

Anyway, I’ll make sure to put a commendation in my next report to Lieutenant Kaneth about you. Oh, and while you were out dealing with the grinnin, someone came through here that was looking for you. But get some rest first; you look like you need it. After you’re rested, come see me and I’ll tell you where to find her.
Ready for more, huh? So about that person looking for you. She said her name was Mathra. She seemed a bit preoccupied.

I think she was heading up to the Bone Lake outpost and wanted you to meet her there. I'm sure our outpost there could use your help, too. That is, if you're looking for more work. Just take the east road at the crossing north of here to get to Bone Lake. I’d tell you to be careful on the way there, but I don’t think you’ll need to.

npcs.name: Shady Swashbuckler XVIII
utterances: What do you want?  Unless you have a ship ready to put out to sea I don't have time for you.

I got a really good deal on a few rare items and I'm shipping out before anyone catches on.  Tell you what... if I have something that used to be yours I'll sell it back if you keep it all quiet like.  I'm only going to do this deal for you, got it?

npcs.name: Skevya
utterances: This forest is no place for someone like me.  The darkness is so different...

npcs.name: Stalker Pulsarian
utterances: You're lucky we're far from Freeport, or I'd have you executed for speaking to me!  Unless you're a mercenary here to take a contract, leave now before we dump your body in the woods.

Listen to me, scum...  You're here to take a contract, not to ask questions.  All you need to know is that I'll pay you when you finish the job. Now, are you going to take the contract, or do I have to feed you to the owlbears?
Then here's your contract.  All the details you need to know are listed here.  Remember... I pay you when you complete the assignment. The Overlord pays for success, not for failure.

Well, what do you know?  You managed to finish the job.  I expected you to join the ranks of the undead here in the Forest.  Here's your payment -- the Overlord always pays people their just rewards.  Are you lookin' for another contract?
I paid you for your work.  Quit bothering me.

npcs.name: a supply vigilante
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.
Look what strolled into the spider's web!

npcs.name: Szin Te'val
utterances: I can't be bothered with you.  Jaeta might have something for you however.

npcs.name: Tanny Granville
utterances: Are you just sightseeing, or are you interested in some work?
My brother and I are opening a restaurant.  Right now, we're looking for exotic ingredients to put on our menu.

Yes, exactly.  Tobias is in the Thundering Steppes working on a seafood bisque.  I'm allergic to shellfish, so I'm concentrating on more woodsy items.  I'm looking for folks who know how to gather items from the woods and can hunt a bit as well.  Will you help me?

We're still a fledgling business, but I can pay for your services.  I'm looking for various edible plants among the natural gardens here in Nektulos.  You'll have to discard any toxic species, of course. Do you know how to recognize the poisonous ones?
Hello again!
Do you have all my ingredients?

Excellent!  They're perfect. I'll take these and you can keep the rest. You did such a fine job; can I trouble you to do something else?  I'd like to grill some kodiak steaks  for the restaurant. Trouble is, I'm a chef and not a hunter. These bears are too rough for me, but I'll bet you could take down some on your own. Couldn't you?
Did you get some bear meat?

I've heard that there are some interesting crustaceans on the shores near Port Naythex.  If there are, perhaps my brother could use them.  Could you check it out and let me know?  I do hate to be a bother, but you've been so helpful.

You've no idea how much this means to me!  Tobias is always interested in fish and seafood and the like.  I'm sure it will bring a smile to his face when I give him some new ingredients to use in his recipes.

You've been a big help. Unfortunately, my brother Tobias doesn't trust me with much coin. This is all I have. You can always visit him in the Thundering Steppes and see if he has work he can pay you for.
Thank you again for all your help!

npcs.name: Tarren Marrsen
utterances: The Hand of Marr will assist those who assist us. You are not such a person.

npcs.name: Taskmaster D'Zran
utterances: I'm sorry, but I only hand out special contracts.  If you're interested in performing duties for the Far Seas Trading Company, please view the bulletin of outstanding orders.

npcs.name: Theeral the nomad
utterances: Take heed! An ancient grandeur hungers for your presence.
Sit and chat. I've been waiting for you. I know where you're going.
Don't let my frailty fool you! I've lived within this deadly realm for a long time. I have no shield nor do I wield a blade, yet I survive. Come closer. I have a gift for you.
My voice, was it? Is that what you heard? Or was it just the wind?
Save your boasts! I've waited a long time for you to come here. As I said, I have something for you.
I have an old tome. It's a tome bound of flesh and scribed in blood. It has many secrets ... secrets for you to reveal.
Take it! Look upon the flesh bound pages. Your answers can only be found within. Fate has waited far too long. Go, I am sure we shall meet again.
You found evidence of Nektropos Castle? You must gain entry to find your fate. But arcane powers placed in ages past keep the tormented souls trapped within.

The Dragoons of Gul'Thex placed a powerful ward upon the walls of the castle. A herald is unable to welcome any guests unless this ward is interrupted. Even in death, the herald welcomes those who are invited.
In the vale of Nektropos rests an artifact that powers the ward. Speak the ward words of the dragoons, and you will be imbued with the power to interrupt the ward.
Within the yard of Nektropos are three monuments engraved with the words of the ward. Study the glyphs of each of these monuments and seek out the artifact. But that is not all...
Only a dragoon lieutenant could understand such glyphs. You are not one, but many lurk in an undead state within this forest.
You must claim their sight. He who holds the flesh bound tome holds the power to do this. Hunt them down. With each dragoon lieutenant you fell, you shall claim a portion of this sight.

npcs.name: a Thexian assassin
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.
There is no escape for you now!
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: a Thexian ruffian
utterances: There is no escape for you now!
Look what strolled into the spider's web!
I hope you put your affairs in order.
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: a Thexian scout
utterances: I will have vengeance!
Look what strolled into the spider's web!
There is no escape for you now!
Hold them and I'll return with help!

npcs.name: a thexian searcher
utterances: I will have vengeance!
Hold them and I'll return with help!
I hope you put your affairs in order.
Look what strolled into the spider's web!
You'll pay for that one, peon!
There is no escape for you now!

npcs.name: a Thexian Vin chosen
utterances: Look what strolled into the spider's web!
Hold them and I'll return with help!
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: a Thexian Vin guard
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.
Hold them and I'll return with help!
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: Thraixe Il'ferrai
utterances: Who are you? Oh, hired help! Well, you can get to work right now. There might be a position available within the Brethren if you're good enough.
Oh, the rewards are far better than you'll see working with those ignorant do-gooders. We recognize the true power that's hidden behind the Timber falls.
Haha! That's a good one! I'm not going to tell you unless we can come to an agreement. We can't have a deal without terms.

One: You will work for the Brethren for as long as we deem necessary. Two: Information will be dispensed to you as we see fit. If your standing increases, of course, I'm sure your assignments will become more important ... and more lucrative. Three: What we say goes. Take it or leave it.
Very well. You don't need to know everything at this point, but understand that we are here to study the possibility that a sect of Teir'Dal made this their home after Neriak's fall.

In addition to some other information about them--which I cannot reveal at this point--there exists a firm belief that they may have some items of an extremely powerful nature. We seek to recover them.
Along with others, yes. Khri and Keryx have reported some interesting rock formations in the caverns. I want you to gather samples from these rocks for my studies.

npcs.name: Torq De'Rech
utterances: It appears Bruhn is not finished with you yet.

I see Bruhn has deemed you worthy to attempt the rest of the Trials. You are the first in quite some time. You have been sent to me so that you no longer wander aimlessly across the forest, waiting to be slaughtered.

So you say, but that doesn't matter. I have spent centuries exploring and learning the woods. I know Nektulos Forest better than any other living sentient. This forest is my home. I can teach you some of what I know if you are willing to learn.

You should be appreciative. First things first, though. There has been a little rat of a dwarf running all over the woods. I have no clue what he is doing. The fool is crazed. I sent a human named Daria after him and she has yet to return. I want to know what that dwarf is doing.
Go and find Daria. Last time I heard from her, she was nearing N'Mar's Ascent. Go there and see what that dwarf is up to.
Welcome back. I assume you found Daria.
Dwarves are a strange race. Too much time in the mines ruins one's brain. Anyway, speak to me again when you are ready for your next task.
Ready for more I see. An important aspect of survival in Nektulos Forest is learning what is and isn't edible. You don't want to starve now, do you?

For starters, there aren't any edible berries in this entire forest. Not berries that you can forage, anyway. Luckily, we are close to the fertile, sunny, bright and happy Thundering Steppes. There are usually food crates sitting unattended on the Steppes docks, especially in a building up the stairs when you first land. I believe a Sage is usually present, but he has never bothered us. Go and re-provision us.
Hope you don't get sea sick.

Ah, I see the dock authorities in the Steppes are starting to wise up. These berries are actually very poisonous if ingested. They are named Thorn Berry. Here, take this. It is a poison made from the berries. Don't eat it.
Nice to see you haven't eaten the poison I gave you. I suppose you are here to learn more.

Do you know how many species and types of animals and other creatures roam this forest? I could tell you, but I believe experience is a better teacher. Take this list and catalog each of these creatures as you locate them.
Don't suppose, do... Now, go!
I see you weren't eaten by the owlbears. Ready for more?
Good. What you are standing on right now is a beach. You know, sand near water. Go explore the water and bring me back the remains of others who tried to explore it.
A little advice: Try not to look like food to the sharks.
Well done. I'm impressed that you're still in one piece. Here is a little reward for you. Come back when you dry out.

Since you still have all of your limbs, it is clear you haven't been risking them enough. I know you've been avoiding the owlbears and, not only does it hurt their feelings, but it makes me think you are a coward. You aren't a coward, are you?
Good! Go and get me five owlbear feathers.
Watch your fingers.
Good work. Come see me again when you are ready for your last challenge.
Have you absorbed enough of my lessons to face this last test?

It is time to see just how dense you are. There is an owlbear that has been alive and roaming these woods since the cataclysm. I have left her alone, but I want you to find and kill her. Can you do this?
Good luck.

npcs.name: The Traveling Augur
utterances: Ah, so you've arrived at last! I wondered when you would seek my knowledge of the meaning of life.  Come closer and we shall begin your quest for enlightenment, my child.

And yet, you have found me, have you not?  Whether consciously or not, many seek the wisdom and foresight of the Augurs.  We are many, as there are many paths to self-awareness and enrichment.  I can give you the keys to some of the meanings of life, if you desire.

The first meaning you must learn is the expansion of one's mind.  Many times, we channel our energies toward outward manifestations of peril when in reality the greatest peril is internal.  Traveling is one way to expand one's mind.  Go, then, and return when you've finished your journey.
And so you return.  Have you traveled far and seen much?

Broadening one's mind does not mean neglecting that which is close at hand.  The act of harvesting even one item from a group of weeds, or of catching a single fish from a school is to learn that everything large is comprised of another that is small.  Do you understand this, my child?

Must you answer each question of mine with a question of your own?  It is quite disconcerting.  In any event, go into the wilds and search for a single item within a larger group of similar items.  When you have the skill to separate a mote of dust from the earth, return to me.
Have you been able to select a single item from its greater surroundings?

Two of three meanings of life have I taught you. But have you truly learned your lesson?  Broadening the mind through travel and seeing the minute among the mighty are two ways to strengthen your understanding.  The final way is through personal effort, which will enhance your self-awareness and control.

Your mind is active, my child.  It is time your body followed suit.  These personal efforts will enrich you and through these efforts, you will achieve a greater insight into this meaning of life.  Follow these simple instructions and return when you understand.
You've returned, as I had foreseen.

I am not telling you everything, only that which you might comprehend.  Your personal efforts work in concert with the broadening of your mind and the exquisite vision techniques of seeing that which is unseen by many.  Three meanings of life that coalesce into one simple constant.  Do you understand now, my child?

Then you are not ready, my child.  A pity.  Perhaps when you have studied for as many years as I have, you will realize that these three meanings of life are essential elements of all that you experience.  The broadening of the mind, seeing the individual amongst the many and personal effort.  I foresee much personal effort on your part.

npcs.name: Trelech Stonehome
utterances: I haven't seen you around before, but we might be interested in takin' you on.  Whaddya say, you want to hear more about the Hand of Marr?
Now, I'm sure you're not interested in a dissertation on our principles, but I will tell you this: We remain dedicated to the ideals of the Knights of Thunder and the Knights of Truth.
Ahh, they were a holy order dedicated to the Truthbringer, Mithaniel Marr.  They worked closely with the priests of Marr, long before the Battle of Defiance.
Ages, and ages. No telling exactly how long ago. Arthial may have a better idea, but we have things to do before that!
None of our explorations into the dank caves behind the waterfall have yielded much information.  That is, if our scouts have even returned!  Please see what you can find out about the tombs below.
We sent four scouts down below. If you can find them, gather the information they have and bring it back; we'd be very appreciative.  Will you aid the Hand of Marr?
Oi, I'm sorry, wee one, we're a bit busy. Come back later when yer all grow'd up!

npcs.name: Valten Darkcleanse
utterances: My poor twin sister is trapped within these cursed walls. There is little I can do but weep for her tortured soul.

npcs.name: Vanquisher Sharhan
utterances: What is it you want, demon-spawn?
I know how you fools from Freeport are: egocentric, narcissistic brutes. Why are you speaking to me?
If you must know, I am here to crush the demonic existence that has been brewing in these very woods since before the cataclysm.
The Thexians, you fool! They are raising an evil that must not be allowed to be unearthed.

Well, long ago, before the fall of Neriak there was a very powerful Necromancer. He found a way to steal the souls of not just the dead, but the living as well. He fed on every living and dead thing within his grasp, until there was nothing left but his own people.

The streets of Neriak slowly began to empty. The great dark elf army's numbers dwindled as the Necromancer fed on everyone and everything. His hunger could not be contained. The many mages of the dark elves figured out what was happening and joined together, using all of their combined power, to bury the Necromancer's lair far below the earth. But we have received reports that the Thexians, in their misguided attempts at power, have disturbed this lair.

I tell you because I, like my fathers before me, have been given the duty of making sure this Necromancer will never be unearthed. The cataclysm has hindered our efforts. Fallen Gate, that wretched evil place, has been excavated and it seems several artifacts of this Necromancer were looted by the Thexians. They are using them to join and raise the Necromancer. I cannot let this happen.

Well, I tried, but unfortunately I was wounded in my attempt. I take much pride in my fighting ability, but I was not prepared for the Thexians' numbers. I fear they will reach the lair's ruins before I am healed enough to stop them.
I suppose if you wished to help, you could find the artifacts and stop the Thexians or at least delay them until I am healed.

They are blood runes. Special stones made with the blood of the Necromancer, providing him an undying tie to this world. You need to retrieve all five. If the Thexians even have one of the stones they can cause quite a bit trouble.
I know not your motivation, but thank you, adventurer, and be careful.
Have you found the blood runes or any other useful information?
I feared that they may have accessed it already. Tell me, how are they getting there? A tunnel?

Ahh, now several things that seemed out of place make sense. When I was injured I noticed several guards standing around an obelisk-shaped monument. I thought it odd at the time, but did not think it was related to this. The obelisk was located in the camp.

Unfortunately, I am still suffering from my injuries. I can barely stay on my feet, so there is no way I could enter the lair and stop the Thexians. I would be indebted to you if you would go there and investigate the situation. My greatest concern is that they may be attempting to raise the necromancer from his grave. Please, go see if they are and stop them.
Good, and be careful. In a necromancer's lair there are more dangerous things than Thexians.

npcs.name: a vengeful soul
utterances: My compatriot is free at last.
Might there be a release from this ... existence?

npcs.name: Ytheri Coldtouch
utterances: I'm sorry. I cannot help you right now. I must attend to other duties.

npcs.name: Zalia Highbourne
utterances: The damage here is bad, but I hear it is worse in Thundering Steppes. You should go there.
All will end in cataclysm, it's just a matter of which one. It is the great cycle of the universe.

npcs.name: Zesnitra K`Jartan
utterances: Look at all the wriggling crawlies!  Delightful!

npcs.name: Zsik Nee
utterances: Greetings, Adventurer...
